title: Fix Shop page Select empty value error and remove Caffeine attribution from footer

requirements.text: Fix the Shop page runtime error by ensuring every <SelectItem /> in Shop filters uses a non-empty value prop, while still allowing users to clear a filter and see the placeholder state.

quotes:
Shop page shows this error:
A <Select.Item /> must have a value prop that is not an empty string. This is because the Select value can be set to an empty string to clear the selection and show the placeholder.

acceptanceCriteria: Visiting the Shop page does not throw the error: "A <Select.Item /> must have a value prop that is not an empty string".
All filter dropdowns on ShopPage (Category, Gold Type, Stone Type, Sort By) have no SelectItem with value="".
Each filter still supports an 'all/default' selection that clears the corresponding filter state (category/goldType/stoneType/sortBy become null) and shows the placeholder text.
Existing filter option values (e.g., rings, necklaces, eighteenK, fourteenK, diamond, ruby, sapphire, newest, priceLowToHigh, priceHighToLow) continue to work as before.

requirements.text: Remove the 'Built with â€¦ caffeine.ai' / 'designed by caffeine' attribution link and related UI from the site footer so the footer only contains AMOR content (keep copyright text and existing footer navigation/contact sections).

quotes: Also I want to remove the designed by caffeine logo in the footer.

acceptanceCriteria: The footer no longer displays any Caffeine attribution text/link (including "Built with" and the caffeine.ai link).
No Caffeine referral URL is rendered in the footer.
Footer layout remains visually consistent after removing the attribution block (no broken spacing/alignment).

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui (compose only; do not modify).
Keep changes limited to addressing the Shop page Select error and removing footer attribution; do not introduce new features or redesign unrelated pages.
nonGoals: Adding new Shop filters or changing the product filtering logic beyond what is necessary to fix the Select value error.
Changing authentication, backend APIs, or database/state schema.
